10/10

Description: Contemporary Italian eatery providing Neapolitan, wood-fired pizzas, plus small plates & gelato.

summary.snippet: "Excellent pizza, classy atmosphere, good service, nice people!"
"The crust, cheese and toppings were good but the sauce ruined my experience."
"Salads, gluten free pasta, desserts, and tasty appetizers."

most_relevant.description: This place menu is quite diverse in salads and pizza. I have tried it several times and the food is ok in general. Anything I tried never wowed me but it was delicious enough to go back. Bur I live the many seating options both in summer and winter. Really spacious and nice atmosphere, good for big groups. One problem is they don’t split checks. They say they take multiple payments but it becomes way to complicated and we always end up paying each our companies.

We recently visited Bigalora Wood Fired Cucina and had a good experience. We tried the Mediterranean and Pesto Genovese pizzas, the ricotta-stuffed shells pasta, and the focaccia. All of the dishes were delicious. The service was also good, making for an overall great dining experience.

Dined in on 09.07.24. Not from the area, so I searched up best pizza in the area and came here. It was amazing. Very nice restaurant and the staff was nice. Aston was our server and he was very attentive! Would highly recommend 👌!

We went for dinner and loved the food, service and ambiance.
The bread with marinara sauce was amazing, loved the pizzas, chicken parm and fish.

Tiramasrhu was great - perfect.

Dined in on 09/01/2024– ordered a gluten free pizza and it was inedible. The crust was so hard it could neither break it into pieces with my hands nor bite through it. Gluten free crust is pretty much always drier and harder than regular crust, it should never go into the over for too long. Do not come here for the gf pizzas. I could only eat the somewhat edible parts although it was still difficult to chew. Photo included.

Ordered 2 pizzas, their special of the day soup(kale sausage and potatoes). Also the tiramisu.
The mortadella pizza hands down is my new obsession. The pistachio pesto is the perfect pairing! Extra done with red pepper flakes easily made this the best pizza I've had.
The funghi pizza was meh. I added caramelized onion and zucchini to mine. It's missing something and I'm just not sure what. I had ordered red sauce on the side but sadly got food to go and it wasn't included.
The soup was not great. Very bland. Definitely not worth the price. Also container was half empty...
Tiramisu was solid and a decent sized piece. I'm very happy with it. Very fresh tasting. Strong coffee flavor that was extremely pleasantly balanced with the cream.

Unfortunately, I found Bigalora lacking. I ordered the pepperoni pizza and the dessert pizza. Both severely lacked flavor and were overwhelmed by the dough. Definitely not worth the price of admission.

This place is just all around great. We had the ancient grains salad, the prosciutto di parma pizza, and the Brussels sprouts appetizer. The salad was great, healthy and fibrous and filling, with a flavorful light dressing. The pizza toppings weren't as integrated into the pizza as I personally would prefer but they were quality ingredients and the dough was DELICIOUS. The Brussels didn't look the most appetizing but they were honestly the best I've ever had in a restaurant.
